alert.note: Alert for Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sierra County Lakes (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 13 at 3:38PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT TUESDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Tuesday. * WHAT... Winds will be out of the west-southwest sustained around 10 mph and gusts up to 20 mph. Smoke from the Pipeline Fire in Arizona will likely move in over the northwest part of the state. Smoke from the fires in western areas of the state will tend to drift toward the east through the remainder of the afternoon and evening. Light and more variable wind conditions expected in the vicinity of the Black fire causing the smoke to drift to the areas around Caballo and Truth or Consequences. Impacts from Midnight Fire and Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Fire will be localized and may impact areas around Angel Fire, Taos, Cimarron and Scout Ranch. * WHERE... Smoke impacts will be widespread around Farmington and in most parts of San Juan County. Moderate smoke impacts will be localized across portions of Taos, Mora, and eastern Sierra counties. Elsewhere, brief moderate impacts are expected at times between the Rio Grande Valley and Continental Divide but widespread unhealthy conditions are not expected. More details and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov * WHEN... Remainder of this afternoon through at least 1pm MDT Tuesday, June 14th.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sierra County Lakes
